subject: History
description: Students can analyse different interpretations of the establishment of early societies, explain global patterns of continuity and change and the sources of historical evidence of the period. Students recognise the contested nature of the histories of early and pre-modern societies and apply this knowledge to identify and analyse different historical interpretations and debates.
rubric_focus: Analyzing interpretations, recognizing contested histories, explaining patterns of continuity and change

subject: History
description: They can describe the historical significance of the histories of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples' histories and cultures, ancient societies of Europe, Africa or Asia, and societies leading to the modern world between 600 and 1750 CE.
rubric_focus: Demonstrating historical knowledge of specific periods and societies, describing historical significance

subject: History
description: Students develop and apply historical questions to support the process of historical inquiry, when using historical concepts and sources across the range of historical contexts.
rubric_focus: Developing inquiry questions, applying historical concepts

subject: History
description: They order historical narratives of events, ideas and developments chronologically to explain varied patterns and forms of continuity and change and their causes and consequences.
rubric_focus: Explaining continuity and change, analyzing cause and consequence, chronological ordering

subject: History
description: Students explain the features, content and context of primary and secondary sources and apply historical questions when drawing inferences from sources. They interpret the information from historical sources by analysing and verifying their accuracy and value as historical evidence.
rubric_focus: Source analysis skills, evaluating evidence, verifying accuracy and value

subject: History
description: Students use primary and secondary sources to identify and explain the perspectives of individuals and groups and use these sources to understand the beliefs, values and attitudes of the individuals and societies studied.
rubric_focus: Understanding historical perspectives, identifying beliefs and values

subject: History
description: They establish and analyse historical significance using criteria to recognise and analyse the role and contributions of individuals, events, locations, developments and legacies of the societies they have studied.
rubric_focus: Analyzing historical significance with criteria, evaluating contributions and legacies

subject: History
description: When constructing historical interpretations of the societies studied, students use historical concepts, terms, concepts, relevant knowledge, conventions and evidence obtained from their analysis of primary and secondary historical sources.
rubric_focus: Evidence-based historical arguments, using historical concepts and conventions
